review: Bought mine at the $20 price when first launched.  It works well and I like having the included remote.  At the $40 price point I'd probably go with a Chromecast if you don't mind casting.You can side load other apps on this fairly easy.
author: Bimmerman

review: Greatest thing to TV since the invention of the flat screen! I LOOOOOVE this unit: small, unnoticable and easy to install. Just plug it in, plug the provided USB power cord and adapter in, turn your set on to the apropriate input selection, and follow the prompts! You get complete access to all of your library contents, Prime contents, purchases, music, and New-Release Movie rental. I love that I can use it for my Netflix account, too . . . not that I really NEED it with all the stuff I can access on Prime.
author: G. E. Glau

review: I ordered my Fire TV Stick because I like using Amazon Prime content on my Kindle Fire HD.  The setup was quick and easy.  My only problem was getting audio to work thru my receiver.  The tech I talked to at Amazon wasn't sure if I could plug the Stick directly into my receiver.  So I searched online, and found that the competitors were able to connect directly to receivers.  So, I gave it a try, and it worked GREAT.This little device is very fast and easy to use.  I was afraid my wifi would not be fast enough.  But movies stream without any buffering or voice lag.
author: Amazon Customer

review: This is beyond a doubt the easiest technology device to install and get up and running. WOW!!  It probably took a whole 5 minutes!  We're on our 2nd movie already. LOVE it!!!!
author: Pam Shaver

review: Wouldn't work, had to go through 2 different tech support to find out Amazon registered it to different person. No Volume control, still have an issue viewing movies I pick through the play store. Netflix works well, Sling tv is a pain to use on this box.
author: Thomas

review: The Fire stick was easy to set up and  begin using.  The HD picture is excellent and the variety of TV shows  and movies that are included is pretty good.  My only complaint would be the amount of content, including TV shows, that you still need to pay for even with an Amazon Prime membership. But all in all I would say I have enjoyed it so far.
author: John M.

review: Not as good as my ROKU, but the ROKU was $99 and the Fire Stick was $39.
author: Rene Tricou

review: Outstanding ...  received it earlier than promised and it works very well.  I like the menu that shows up on the TV.  Very easy to use.  :-)
author: Phil

review: So far so good! So easy to use.  Easy to set up.  We were having some issues with using our Blu Ray to view things on Amazon Prime.  I decided to try this and see if it was any better.  Yes, it is better.  I compared it to the Google Chrome stick and the Roku Streaming stick and decided this would be our best bet.  Compared to a friends Google Chrome......we made a good decision.
author: Kimberly Owens

review: Was (still is?) advertised as being Miracast certified - in the table comparing it with the Roku stick and the Chromecast - when it's not.Despite repeated comments in the forums pointing out that this product is not in the list at Wi-Fi.org and pointing out the text on the Wi-Fi.org website regarding what it means to be "Wi-Fi Certified", Amazon has refused to either make the device compatible with Miracast enabled source devices outside of the list they publish, OR retract their assertion that the device is Miracast certified.The unit does NOT work with any of the Windows 8.1 based devices I used to test and there are multiple people in the Q & A and review sections that indicate the same thing.This is at odds with the Wi-Fi Alliance's stated requirements Read for yourself, particularly the paragraph under "Easy to use, multi-vendor wireless display"... h t t p : / / w w w . w i - f i . o r g / d i s c o v e r - w i - f i / w i - f i - c e r t i f i e d - m i r a c a s t (take the spaces out)Other than that, it's an ok alternative to other cord cutting devices, even though it seems somewhat buggier than the competition.
author: DaddyPutItTogetherPlease "Greg H"
